page.title: 16Moyn's Park, Birdbrook.
page.content: Moyn's Park is named after the{Le {Moigne's}who were there in 1254.In the 14th century,Joan Le Moigne widow of William{Gent}(of Birdbrook ) inherited the estate which then continued in the Gent family .Sir Thomas Gent worked for Queen Elizabeth 1 and was her faithful servant. The Gent family were very wealthy and William Gent rebuilt the north east wing.Until recently, {Mr. John Bryce}owned the estate.When he died he left it to his great-nephews,{the Marquess of {Milford-Haven and Lord Ivor {Mountbatten.}There are 35 rooms in the house.There are 4 principal rooms on the ground floor.{The dining room}has a beautiful regency chandelier and coromandel screens.{The Library}has some racing paintings from the 18th century by J.F.Herring and Harry Hall.{The Great Hall}contains many
